page.title: 06HEATH AND STANBRIDGE FARMS
page.content: These farms were combined but Heath Farm house is separate and a small printing press uses some of the farm buildings. All the land is farmed from Stanbridge.{Crops:}The total acreage is 560; 150 acres are used for grain, wheat 70 acres, winter barley 50 acres andspring barley 30 acres. The wheat and 50% of the barley is sold. The rest of the barley is used for animal feed. Much of the grass is converted into silage. {Livestock:} Pasture is used to support a large milking herd of 200 Friesians. A Hereford bull and 106 Friesian heifers are also kept. Milking takes place at both farms using the herring-bone style of milk parlours.{Mechanisation: There are 2 herdsmen and 3 tractor drivers. There are 2 'yard' tractors and 4 working tractors.
